comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: SMH news item nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16846801 Looks like quite a few Dorman Long & Co and NSW Public Works Department staff in/around the front tram. Apart from JJC Bradfield, there's not enough resolution to identify any of them with certainty.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] Do we have a higher res photo that quasymody can look at?

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: "the first two tram to cross the sydney harbour bridge were "o" cars 1106 and 1212 built by meadowbank manufacturing co. around 1910 car 1212 was still in service to make it's last run in june 1958 - a half century lifespan"

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Slightly higher res version uploaded - see how that goes!

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: Bring back the 1930's fedora hats for men !

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Thanks [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] and [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] !!! All these blokes in fedoras look the same! Sources re names: R.J. Butler appears in a number of Harbour Bridge pics from the various collections. He was one of the senior NSW Public Works Department engineers overseeing the construction of the bridge. He features in this 1932 pic of NSW PWD Harbour Bridge Staff www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8282694749/ and he's also identified in this pic investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... we see him in numerous other pics where he isn't identified, eg. www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8283763420/ Henry Martin (and also J. Muir) appear in this 1932 SMH pic of Dorman Long & Co staff trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1157143 ...I'm only maybe 60% convinced Martin is the chap I've noted. William Roper and Bill Lush identified here investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... ; they also appear in these pics www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5557266594/ ; www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5578135858/in/pho... ...I'm 90% convinced on Roper, but only about 60% on Lush. J. Muir also identified via this pic trove.nla.gov.au/work/168706425?q=bradfield;+ennis;+litch... ; he also appears in these pics www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/7218793732/ ; investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... It also looks as though a few of these chaps might have been present www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/6351745997/in/set...
